huggingfaceR 0.1.0
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • The Hugging Face Hub

    • Introduction To Tokenizers

    Reference

    Tokenizers

    Load a tokenizer from Hugging Face’s transformers library

    hf_load_tokenizer()

    Load an AutoTokenizer from a pre-tained model

    Models

    Load a model from Hugging Face’s transformers library.

    hf_load_model()

    Load a pre-trained AutoModel object from Hugging Face

    hf_load_AutoModel()

    Import a pre-trained model for a specific task.

    Pipelines

    Load a pipeline from Hugging Face’s transformers library

    hf_load_pipeline()

    Load a pipeline object from Hugging Face - pipelines usually include a model, tokenizer and task.

    hf_load_sentence_model()

    Load a Sentence Transformers model to extract sentence/document embeddings

    hf_sentence_encode()

    Use a Sentence Transformers pipeline to extract document(s)/sentence(s) embedding(s)

    Datasets

    Load a local data set or search and load models from the Hugging Face Hub

    hf_list_datasets()

    List Datasets

    hf_load_dataset()

    Load a dataset from the Hugging Face Hub!

    The Hub

    Functions for interacting directly with Hugging Face’s hub

    hf_search_models()

    Search Models

    hf_list_models()

    List Models

    hf_list_languages()

    List Languages

    hf_list_licenses()

    List Licenses

    hf_list_authors()

    List Authors

    hf_list_libraries()

    List Libraries

    hf_list_tasks()

    List Tasks

    Inference

    Interact with Hugging Face’s inference API/Endpoints

    hf_predict()

    Use a Hugging Face pipeline or model_id to quickly predict on your inputs

    hf_set_device()

    Try to set device to GPU for accelerated computation

    hf_python_depends()

    Install Python Dependencies

    Contents
